item.title: Pam add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Pam add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Pam add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Pam add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "If you look for truth, you may find comfort in the end; if you look for comfort you will not get either comfort or truth only soft soap and wishful thinking to begin, and in the end, despair." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Pam add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A young man who wishes to remain a sound atheist cannot be too careful of his reading." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Pam add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "One can never have enough socks," said Dumbledore. "Another Christmas has come and gone and I didn't get a single pair. People will insist on giving me books." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Pam add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Pam add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Hearing voices no one else can hear isn't a good sign, even in the wizarding world." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Pam add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "<i>Ginny!</i>" said Mr. Weasley, flabbergasted. "Haven't I taught you <i>anything</i>? What have I always told you? Never trust anything that can think for itself <i>if you can't see where it keeps its brain</i>?" -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Pam add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Pam add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "If the world were merely seductive, that would be easy. If it were merely challenging, that would be no problem. But I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E.B. White

item.title: Pam add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Professor Kettleburn, our Care of Magical Creatures teacher, retired at the end of last year in order to enjoy more time with his remaining limbs." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Pam add a quote by Arthur Schopenhauer
item.description: "Talent hits a target no one else can hit. Genius hits a target no one else can see." -- Arthur Schopenhauer

item.title: Pam add a quote by Ronald Reagan
item.description: "The most terrifying words in the English language are: I'm from the government and I'm here to help." -- Ronald Reagan
